semantic_identifier: 127: feat: issue_clustering v2: Drift detection w/ persisted signals, alerts, and audit trail

sections.text:
## Description

Adds cluster drift detection to issue_clustering v2 and wires it into alerting + auditability.

Implementation:
- Introduces a drift evaluation step in the v2 pipeline that compares the latest run against a configurable baseline (previous successful run by default) and flags drift when thresholds are exceeded.
- Computes drift metrics at both cluster-assignment and embedding-distribution levels (e.g., assignment churn rate and distribution distance over embeddings), emitting per-cluster and global summaries.
- Persists drift signals in a new drift_events store/table, capturing: run_id, detected_at timestamp, baseline_run_id, affected cluster_ids, metric values, thresholds, and a severity (HIGH when thresholds breached).
- Generates a high-priority alert when drift is detected (deduped per run) including top affected clusters and the metric deltas to speed triage.
- Adds a lightweight audit trail by storing references from each drift event to the underlying source conversations (conversation_ids / sample issue_ids) and a field for downstream tracking (e.g., linked Linear/Jira work item id), enabling defensibility and traceability.

Config/ops:
- Adds config knobs for drift thresholds (assignment churn %, embedding distance, minimum sample size) and baseline selection mode.
- Includes migrations/backfill for the new drift_events persistence and updates run logs/telemetry to include drift status.

User impact:
- No changes to clustering outputs; new drift events and alerts appear only when drift thresholds are exceeded, requiring triage due to high-priority classification.
